quoteText: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: I don't like that man. I must get to know him better.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: Don't worry when you are not recognized, but strive to be worthy of recognition.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: We the people are the rightful masters of both Congress and the courts, not to overthrow the Constitution but to overthrow the men who pervert the Constitution.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: How many legs does a dog have if you call his tail a leg? Four. Saying that a tail is a leg doesn't make it a leg.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quoteText: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
author: Abraham Lincoln
